metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23998 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Through complicated navigations with new windows, an HTTP page could have inherited a secure lock icon from an HTTPS page. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.10, Thunderbird < 78.10, and Firefox < 88.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23998` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2').
mozjs78 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2').
